utterance.speaker: LOLA
utterance.content: Did you see that tunic Professor Jablonski was wearing yesterday in Advanced Draping?

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: I know. It was very ‘sad cat lady meets David Bowie’.

utterance.speaker: LOLA
utterance.content: This is what it’s come to. Dumpster diving to find fabric for our midterm haute couture project.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Well, you know what they say; one man’s trash is another man’s –

utterance.speaker: LOLA
utterance.content: I think I found something.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: Me too! It’s stuck.

utterance.speaker: LOLA
utterance.content: That’s because we’re both tugging on it. Let go.

utterance.speaker: JUSTIN
utterance.content: I had it first.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Oh, this fabric is just to die for. The lace, the décolletage … this would look stunning on you. Just stunning.

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, you know, I think I –

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother, what are you trying to force on my lovely fiancée?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no. I am just trying to expose Katherine to the glorious world of wedding magazines.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: They are all very girly, with a lot of gauzy photos of love-struck brides looking off into the distance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perhaps they’re contemplating the fifty percent divorce rate?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know what? You need to get beyond the fairytale treacle aspect of these magazines and see them for what they are: a source of ideas as you plan your wedding.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Like this place.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Cordova House? Uh … “A landmark Spanish Revival mansion with an elegant carriage house exterior.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was built at the turn of the century. “… remains an enduring legacy of architectural beauty in the heart of Manhattan.”

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah ha. I remember the Cordova House. It was like a cultural venue for the arts in the 70s. I think I went to a party there. Of course, it was the 70s, so I can’t be sure …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This says it’s been refurbished. And they’ve started to book weddings.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I love it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could it be that we’ve stumbled upon a venue we actually agree on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah! I mean, I’m good with it. Are you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You’re welcome.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, thank you. Sorry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m going to make some inquiries right now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh … you’re going to have to do it while we’re working a case.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, thank you. I appreciate it. All right, apparently we weren’t the only ones to read that article. The event planner at the Cordova House said they’ve been swamped with calls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, when’s their next available date?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She says she’s going to call me back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Espo. What do we got?

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: A body found by two fashion students dumpster diving for fabric. The victim’s name is Ella Hayes, she’s 26. According to her driver’s license she’s got an apartment in Brooklyn.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s she doing down here in the garment district?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Could be something work related. Her business card says that she works for Modern Fashion. She’s an assistant to the editor in chief.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, that would be Matilda King.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Seriously? You’ve never heard of Matilda King?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m betting that most real men haven’t.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes. If by real you mean uninformed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Whatever.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Matilda King is a legend in the fashion industry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or infamous. Depends on your point of view.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, former assistants of hers have written books about how tough she is. A dragon lady that chews people up and spits them out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Does she also strangle them? Because that’s how Lanie said our vic died.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Hey. So the murder weapon was a scarf, a sash, or something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, when did this happen?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on lividity, between 12 and 2AM. I also recovered some blue hairs left on her neck by the attacker.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Blue hairs. So she was killed by a little old lady. Or – Katy Perry.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Animal hairs that were dyed blue, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or … a Dr. Seuss character.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t recall any of them being homicidal.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s true. I need a new theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’ve got one. Our killer was strong and he or she was able to lift the body into the dumpster. Espo, can you get uniforms to canvass the area for any witnesses? Castle and I’ll go to her work, you and Ryan head up to her place. See if there’s anything there that’ll indicate why she was here last night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Right on.

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Ella and I went to Parson’s together. And then we’ve been roommates for the past 2 years. I still can’t believe this.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When was the last time you saw her?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Um … yesterday morning. She was up at five like always. And then out the door to get Matilda’s coffee and cranberry scone on her way to the office.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What about after work? Did you see her then?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Uh, no. I’m a buyer at Saks, so I don’t get home until late.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Did Ella have a boyfriend or a relationship?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: No. She was on call for Matilda 24/7 so she didn’t have time for relationships. Or for the one thing that she really wanted to do.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Which is what?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Design. She hoped working at Modern Fashion would open doors for her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was Ella having any problems that you know of?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Um .. she had been stressed lately, a little more than usual. I asked her; she said it was work, but she didn’t go into details.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Lillian, if you don’t mind, I’d like to have an officer come by and take your statement.

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Of course. Anything I can do to help.

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Oh, we don’t get cell reception in here. You can use my landline if you like.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Here’s my card. If you can remember anything else please give me a call, okay?

utterance.speaker: LILLIAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this is it. The big leagues for anyone who wants to work in fashion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Apparently you have to be a total hottie just to work here. And I’m saying that as a completely detached, soon to be married observer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s okay, Castle. Stare all you want.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, no. But it’s kind of hard not to. I mean, Matilda only hires people that fit the magazine’s brand. You have to look the part.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You seem to know a lot about Matilda King.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, I picked up a thing or two. Hi. We need to speak with Matilda King.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: Do you have an appointment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, I think you missed the part about the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: Please. I just took over this desk this morning. She’s going to freak out if I add you to the schedule. Do you have any idea what happened to the last assistant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. She’s dead.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: Dead? What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA KING
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: Oh God, here she comes.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I won’t take no for an answer. You must join us on the yacht. Giorgio will show his new collection. Gordon Ramsay is cooking, Lady Gaga is performing, pushing the boundaries of style, no doubt in the wrong direction. So let me know.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: New assistant.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: It’s Carrie.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I’ll learn your name when you’ve earned it. Here.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: These are your messages. And Julian Bruckner is waiting in your office.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: And who is this?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, NYPD. We need to ask you a few questions, Ms. King.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Kate Beckett. I never could forget those cheekbones.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … wait, you two know each other?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah. When I was a model for about 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You modeled for Modern Fashion?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I offered her a spread in the January ’99 issue. Nicole Kidman was on the cover. And you passed. To date you’re the only person to tell me no. I’m wall to wall. We’ll have to reschedule.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh … get ready to be told no again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We need to ask you a few questions about your assistant, Ella Hayes. It cannot wait.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: We’ll talk in my office. Hold my calls. By the way, Ella is my former assistant.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Be right with you, Julian.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what do you mean by former?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I fired her yesterday afternoon, after she made a scheduling mistake and I showed up to a board meeting late. And that was after her mistake last week, when I kept the new owner of our magazine waiting for 45 minutes.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN BRUCKNER
utterance.content: Matilda, have you seen the proofs of the Fab Five photoshoot? They are divine.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: They better be, Julian. So far everything you’ve submitted has been rather pedestrian.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: These designers are barely out of diapers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, excuse me. We’re investigating a murder.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: A murder? Of whom?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your former assistant, Ella.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Ella – Ella’s dead? How?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s what we’re trying to figure out. Now, do you know if she had any problems?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: You don’t think this had anything to do with that incident with Grace?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What incident?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And who’s Grace?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Grace is my other assistant, whom I fired because she allowed the scheduling mistakes to happen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was the incident?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Well, apparently yesterday, when Ella and Grace were escorted out of the building by security, they literally got into a brawl. Right in the middle of a photoshoot. The photographer, Serge, had to break it up.

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: Yeah, they really went at it. I mean, it was a full on catfight. It was actually kind of sexy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What was the fight about?

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: It was about the job, okay? I overheard Grace blame Ella for getting her fired.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Serge, how long will this take? I’m up against a deadline to finish my design.

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: You’ll be here as long as it takes to make Matilda happy.

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: The mantra we all live by.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember any other details about the fight?

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: I can do better than that. I can show you some of it. I was shooting at the time and got a few frames with them in the background.

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: There. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you zoom in on that?

utterance.speaker: SERGE
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Check out Grace’s scarf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie said she found blue hairs on Ella’s neck from being strangled.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Grace was dressed to kill.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: Look, I grew up reading Modern Fashion. Working for Matilda King? That was my dream. But when Matilda fires someone, people remember. Which means my career in fashion is pretty much done, thanks to Ella.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you believed it was her fault you got fired.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: It was her fault. She started making mistakes because she was so busy sucking up to designers like Yumi and showing off her sketches. And I paid the price.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which is why you killed her.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: What are you even taking about? We got into a fight. That was it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, okay. Explain this. This blue alpaca scarf was found at your apartment. It’s an exact match to the hairs on Ella’s neck after she was strangled.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: Come on. Other people have that scarf.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but you’re the only one with motive.

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: It was the Christmas gift from Modern Fashion. We all got the scarf. Maybe Ella was wearing hers and someone choked her with it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where were you between 12 and 2AM, Grace?

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: I’d just gotten fired. Some friends took me out and got me drunk. You can ask them.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I will. In the meantime, let’s talk about Ella. Her roommate thought she was having trouble at the office. You worked with her. You know what it was?

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: Actually, there was something else. A few days ago, at lunchtime, I saw her arguing with this guy outside the building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you recognize him?

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: I’d never seen him before. But I overheard them and he was threatening her. He said she had something he wanted and he wouldn’t take no for an answer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was her reaction?

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: She said she was going to call the police if he didn’t leave her the hell alone. And then he stormed off. I tried to ask her what it was all about, but she wouldn’t tell me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you remember him well enough to help us with a sketch?

utterance.speaker: GRACE
utterance.content: I think so.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, this is the guy who threatened Ella.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you believe Grace’s story?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, her alibi checks out and unis found two witnesses that saw him arguing with Ella.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ella was basically a glorified assistant. What could she possibly have had that this man wanted?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, think about it, Castle. Matilda King is the most influential person in fashion, and Ella had direct access to her world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you’re saying this man leveraged Ella to find out which directions hemlines are going next season? Oh! I just came up with a new title. “Murder is the New Black”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Does that even make sense?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, it doesn’t. And here’s something else that doesn’t make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, did you guys find something at Ella’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You could say that. I went to use a landline and I noticed some static when I got near a lamp.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When we popped the lamp open, look what we found inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A bug? Why would someone bug Ella’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because … she is La Femme Nikita and her job at Modern Fashion is just a cover.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s not La Femme Nikita.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still, wire taps, threats from mysterious men, murder. Whatever’s going on here, it’s bigger than fashion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, see if you can get a serial number and let’s figure out who bought that bug.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, thank you very much. Hey, that was the event planner at the Cordova House. They said they still have a few spots open in the fall. She can give us a tour tonight.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Woohoo! Let’s do it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, where are we on Watergate?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the plot thickens. The building manager at Ella’s apartment remembers letting an exterminator into her place about a month ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Usually exterminators get rid of bugs.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Only this one didn’t. The company that he worked for? Doesn’t exist. I mean, what is this about, Castle? Why would someone target Ella?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you already heard and rejected my theory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but your theory doesn’t explain the little detail that Lanie just found out. There’s black coral on the sole of Ella’s shoe. And it wasn’t from the dumpster.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that doesn’t make any sense. Black coral is found in the tropics.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Exactly. So how did this end up on her shoe?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Beckett.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Castle.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sure. So, no luck on the serial number. But we got a hit off the canvass of the crime scene. A seamstress coming off the late shift saw a guy waiting on the corner right near the alleyway where Ella was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We get a description?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. And he matches our sketch.

utterance.speaker: TERESA GOMEZ
utterance.content: Yes. That’s him. He was standing by the alley outside the Broadway Coffee Shop when I walked by.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what time was this?

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: Just after midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you recall how tall he was? What he wore?

utterance.speaker: TERESA
utterance.content: Fabric is my business. He wore a dark suit, nice quality, wool blend. Oh, and he had a distinctive striped tie. Crimson and navy with gold triangles across the stripes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That sounds like a club tie.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Crimson and navy … yes, I know that one. Gold triangles … That’s the Carlton Club tie. If we can match that sketch to one of its members we’ve got our ID.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except clubs like that are notoriously protective about keeping their member’s privacy. They’re not just going to hand over that information.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The club won’t, no. But one of its members might.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After a tough negotiation that involved my Knicks tickets and naming a character in my next book after his Nana, my friend came up with a name. Marcus Conway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so what do we know about him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He is a lawyer at Kellerman Goodfriend.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s one of the city’s biggest law firms. Why is a high powered lawyer going after Ella?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe it has to do with her work. Turns out that Marcus Conway is general counsel for Couture Chic magazine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s chic and not that you would know, but – – they are Modern Fashion’s biggest competitor.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Call Conway’s firm. I want to know where he is.

utterance.speaker: MARCUS CONWAY
utterance.content: Detective, I would think carefully before making these kinds of accusations.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Conway, I am not making any accusations. I am simply stating fact. We have a witness that heard you threatening Ella Hayes and another one that saw you near where she was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right about the same time she ended up that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You need to explain yourself.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA ROBBINS
utterance.content: Marcus, I heard the police were here. What’s going on?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who are you?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: Gloria Robbins. I’m editor in chief of Couture Chic.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: They think I murdered Ella Hayes.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: What? That’s ridiculous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you know who she is?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: This is obviously one huge misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then clear it up. Tell me what you know about Ella Hayes.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: We approached Ella and attempted to … engage her services.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So basically you tried to hire her to get inside information on Modern Fashion.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: I wouldn’t put it that way.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, I’m pretty sure she would, which is why she turned you down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you wouldn’t take no for an answer.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: Look, this is a competitive business with everyone looking to get an edge. Yes, I was aggressive in trying to make a deal. But when she refused, I accepted that and never contacted her again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then why were you less than a block away from where she was killed at about the time she died?

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: Because she called me. She asked me to meet her last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would she do that?

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: Probably because Matilda just fired her. The bottom line is she said she had bombshell information on Modern Fashion. Information that if it got out it would destroy the magazine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Conway, I took a look at Ella’s cell phone records. She never called you last night.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: She did call. And I can prove it. She left me a message.

utterance.speaker: ELLA
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Ella. I changed my mind about your offer. I found out something. Something that will ruin Modern Fashion, take down the whole operation. Meet me at the Broadway Coffee Shop in an hour.

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: I waited around for two hours but she never showed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What information did she want to share?

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: Believe me, I would love to know. But I don’t have the faintest idea.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were you trying to hire her to find out?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: As you may have heard, a tech venture capitalist named Glenn Carter bought Modern Fashion last month. Glenn has big plans to drag Matilda’s precious little magazine into the digital age.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which are?

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: That’s what we wanted to know. So far our website has failed to generate subscription business. If we could get Modern Fashion’s new playbook it could help us strategize and stay one step ahead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you wanted to hire Ella so she could tell you about the new direction the magazine was taking. And when she turned you down that was the extent of your contact?

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: Until she called last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And what about the eavesdropping?

utterance.speaker: CONWAY
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found a listening device in Ella’s apartment.

utterance.speaker: GLORIA
utterance.content: That wasn’t us. We had nothing to do with that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So these records explain why we missed Ella’s phone calls to Marcus Conway. She phoned him using her roommate’s landline. So she told Conway to meet her in the coffee shop in an hour. It would take about twenty minutes to get there from her apartment, so she must’ve been killed on the way there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s a real shame. Looking at her designs, Ella actually had talent.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, the question is, what did she know and did someone kill her to keep her quiet?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I can’t help you out there, but I can tell you that Marcus Conway was telling the truth about not planting that bug.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, the serial number led us to a distributor named Ultimate Intelligence in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do they know who bought it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: James Kavanaugh. Paid for that listening device a month ago.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When does it get interesting?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: When we found out he was former Special Forces, not to mention the head of security at Modern Fashion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, Ella was being spied on by her own magazine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. Oh Beckett, we have that appointment at the Cordova House.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I’m sorry. Duty calls. Can – can you go without me? And see if it’s as good as the pictures?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You trust me to make this decision on my own?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can you go with Martha?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We have to bring James Kavanaugh in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JAMES KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: I’m in the security business. I buy lots of equipment.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah well, this equipment was a listening device that you installed in Ella Hayes’ apartment.

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: If you think that, you’re mistaken.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Really? Because we showed your picture to the super at Ella’s building and he identified you as the exterminator he let into her apartment.

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with what happened to Ella Hayes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You broke into her place. You wired it for sound. And now she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: James. Think about how that looks, bro.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your best bet is to tell us exactly what you know.

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: All I did was bug her place, okay? I mean, once Glenn Carter bought the magazine, home monitoring got to be a common practice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Glenn Carter ordered the surveillance?

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: No. No, he didn’t know anything about it. It was ordered by Matilda King.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Matilda King. You sure about that?

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: Yes, I’m sure. She got all freaked out about someone coming after her job, so she said she didn’t know who she could trust anymore.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, so who monitored the audio from Ella’s apartment?

utterance.speaker: KAVANAUGH
utterance.content: Matilda had me set it up so that it fed directly to her computer.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: You realize what this means?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Ella called Marcus Conway on the landline, told him she could take down the magazine and Matilda heard the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, thank you very much. So, the guard in the lobby of the Modern Fashion building saw Matilda leave there last night at 11:30, and she was in a big hurry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: 11:30? That’s right after Ella called Marcus Conway. Matilda knew that Ella was about to spill the beans and bring down the magazine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Matilda went to stop her. She’s our killer.

utterance.speaker: CARRIE
utterance.content: Wait, wait, wait. She’s on a call.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She can call back.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Glenn! This magazine is not about tweets or likes on Facebook, for God’s sake! For 57 years women have been purchasing this magazine for the fashion!

utterance.speaker: GLENN CARTER
utterance.content: Matilda, please –

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Whenever they’ve had a bad day at work, or at home, they’ve come to us. We are their escape. We are their fantasy. It’s the clothing that stitches it all together. That’s what matters!

utterance.speaker: GLENN CARTER
utterance.content: We’re done here.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Glenn! Glenn?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Oh, I’m sorry. I didn’t see you there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’ve got a hell of a temper, Ms. King.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: It’s not a temper. It’s frustration. Glenn Carter, our new owner, cares more about money than fashion.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that why you’re paranoid he’s going to replace you?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I don’t know what you’ve heard, but I’m Matilda King. My name is synonymous with this magazine. He wouldn’t dare replace me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then why did you order the monitoring of all your employee’s conversations the moment that he bought the magazine?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: You are quite the detective. Take a seat. Yes, since the purchase rumors have been swirling. I’d like to think that they’re just rumors, but I can’t take that chance. I need to know my people are loyal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: By bugging their homes?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: With their permission. We’ve had some loyalty issues, so my lawyers added some fine print to their employment agreements.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you actually believe that’s going to fly in court?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: My lawyers seem to think so. Now, what does this have to do with your investigation?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Look, given the rumors about your job, it must have been disconcerting to find out Ella was taking damaging information on Modern Fashion to the competition.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: To what are you referring? What information?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We don’t know that. But what we do know is moments after she made arrangements to sell that information, you were seen running out of here.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: You think that I ran out to kill Ella?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your head of security says that you’re set up to listen to these recordings live on your computer.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Something I do on the weekend. I’m a little busy running a magazine during the week.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, something that you’re desperate to defend. That’s motive and that’s opportunity.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I ran out of my office last night because I was late for drinks with Oscar de la Renta. Feel free to check. Regarding Ella’s threat to the magazine, I never heard her say that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And you have no idea what Ella was taking to the competition?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: None. But if you find out I’d be curious to know. Anything else, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to need those recordings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, Beckett. Matilda’s alibi checks out. She was having drinks with Oscar until about 2AM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Matilda’s not our killer. And we still have no idea what explosive information Ella was taking to the competition.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I may have found something on these audio files that might shed light on that. So I’ve been going through about a week of inane conversations between Ella and her roommate, but she did place a call the day of the murder that was pretty strange. Check it out.

utterance.speaker: ELLA
utterance.content: Hey, it’s Ella. Something weird is going on inside Modern Fashion. I think someone is targeting me. I need your help. Call me back.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Do we know who was on the other end of that call?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Based on the landline phone records, the call was placed to someone in Modern Fashion. But it was routed through a switchboard, so it doesn’t show who she was connected to.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This directory lists over a hundred people who work there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Lucky I have crazy good hearing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It’s true.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Listen to the beginning again. I had tech analyze those beeps and connect them to the corresponding digits. The call was placed to this extension.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Armando Montoya. He’s an IT tech at Modern Fashion? What was Ella doing calling him for help?

utterance.speaker: ARMANDO MONTOYA
utterance.content: We were friends, you know? To most of the people here I’m invisible. But Ella saw me. She was nice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why did she need your help the day she died?

utterance.speaker: MONTOYA
utterance.content: She wanted me to look at Matilda’s calendar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What for?

utterance.speaker: MONTOYA
utterance.content: Because Matilda missed some important meetings, but Ella was sure she entered them into the calendar correctly. She wanted to know if the calendar had been tampered with.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And was it?

utterance.speaker: MONTOYA
utterance.content: Yeah. Several entries had been changed over the last couple of weeks. All in the middle of the night. When I showed it to her she was convinced someone was trying to set her up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, were you able to tell who made those changes?

utterance.speaker: MONTOYA
utterance.content: No. I tracked them all to an IP address outside of Modern Fashion. It’s the best I could do. I gave her the info and she said she was going to figure out who set her up … and make them pay. The next I hear, she’s dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you still have that IP address?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, okay. I’ll have tech run it down. But why would anyone want to sabotage a fashion assistant?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, Espo. If Ella went after whoever is behind this, maybe she found them.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. I’ll give you a call when I get a location.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, thanks.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: More questions, Detective?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we found evidence that suggests Ella wasn’t responsible for screwing up your appointments. Someone else changed your calendar. Someone outside of this office.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Are you saying I fired Ella for no reason?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know why someone would have done this to her?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: No. But I do know why someone would want to do this to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Ever since Glenn Carter bought Modern Fashion the sharks have been circling. They smell blood.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the calendar mistakes made you look bad at a critical time.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Excuse me. Oh, this is just what I need.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s wrong?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I have to make a decision in the next half hour about a dress in this issue and the model didn’t show up.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Detective Beckett.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: You said no to me years ago when I offered you a job. Might you do a little favor for me now?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh Richard, look at these beautiful antique chandeliers. Oh.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: So if you’re interested I have a couple of slots for fall 2015 still open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me, did you say fall 2015?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: That’s correct.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: When we spoke on the phone I thought we were speaking of this fall.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: No way. That’s been booked for months. Excuse me, but I have to take this call. Look around and uh, I’ll be right back.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah … well. It is a beautiful venue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it is a long time to wait.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well … and a long time to plan.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I just feel like I’ve waited long enough, Mother. I – I don’t want to waste any more time before we take the next step.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Then don’t. I’m sure there’s another venue out there that the two of you will just fall in love with.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: Okay, this never happens. But the Freedmans just called off their wedding and we now have an opening for spring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Spring … 2016?

utterance.speaker: LESLIE
utterance.content: No, this spring. I have a long list of couples that would snatch this up immediately, but since you’re here …

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Do you need any help in there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. You know what, when you asked me to try on a dress and I said yes, I had no idea it was going to be thing kind of a dress.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: It’s amazing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: The embroidery and the Austrian crystal. It’s just … just heavenly.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. It is, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Come.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, this – this probably would have looked better on the model that didn’t show up.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: No, don’t be silly. It’s perfect on you. Trust me, I’m an expert.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: In fact, if I had a daughter this is exactly the kind of dress I would want for her. You are going to make a beautiful bride someday.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Matilda? We’re ready for the accessory spread in the next room.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Excuse me. I’ll be back in five minutes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. How’s the venue?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Amazing. So amazing. And they didn’t have any spots open until fall of 2015, but a couple just broke up. And their unfortunate misery can be our lifelong joy. We can take their spot for this spring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This spring? Wow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know. And there’s a lot of couple who want it. But if I put down a deposit tonight it’s ours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what do you say?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, are you there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: … yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, but I – I thought we agreed that the venue was amazing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, we did. It’s just, I started thinking about the details and the planning that we have to do and I just – I don’t want to rush any of this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. If you’re sure.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Yeah, that is. I – I mean, we’re going to find another venue, Castle. It’s going to be great.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look, if there’s –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey. So tech was able to track down that IP address. Whoever changed that calendar did it from a design studio in SoHo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there any connection between the studio and Modern Fashion?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, there is. It belongs to one of the designers being featured in Modern Fashion’s Fab Five spread. Yumi.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yumi what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Just Yumi. It – I guess if you don’t have a last name you can charge more.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why would he, or someone from his studio, be changing Matilda’s calendar?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know, but I can tell you this. It looks like Ella may have been there the night she was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do you know that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yumi’s website. The current design line being produced in his studio features dresses embellished with coral. And in addition to the fact that this model is hot – – she’s wearing black coral.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The same kind of coral that Lanie found stuck to the bottom of Ella’s shoe.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m probably going to have to call her in for an interrogation.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Well, sweetie, you tell little miss all that Yumi says there’s only one diva in this room. If she doesn’t want to wear the pink Louboutins she is out of the show. Models. Lack of food makes them so very fraught.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Yumi –

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Please. Just Yumi.

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: Okay. Yumi. When was the last time you saw Ella Hayes?

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Ella Hayes?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Matilda’s assistant. The girl who was killed?

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Yes, of course.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well we have reason to believe that she was here last night.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Yes. She was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why was she here?

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: She – she came to ask me for a job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: I told her that I wanted to help, but there was absolutely nothing that I could do. When Matilda King fires someone they are radioactive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you have any idea why she was fired?

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think you do. Someone changed Matilda King’s calendar. Matilda thought it was Ella, but it wasn’t Ella. It was someone from your studio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We traced the IP address. So did Ella. That’s what she was doing here last night. She wasn’t asking for a job. She was looking to find who made those changes. Who ruined her career.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And given the fact that you just lied to us, I am guessing it was you.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Me? Do you have any idea how powerful Matilda King is in the fashion industry? My design is a Fab Five winner. Matilda’s about to make me famous. Messing with her would be career suicide. What could be possibly be my motive?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s simple. You needed to get her fired. You needed to discredit her.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Why on Earth would I do that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because your winning Fab Five design? Isn’t yours.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: From Ella’s sketch book. They’re exactly the same.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Ella was an aspiring designer. She must have copied me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. Ella’s roommate saw her making those sketches months ago.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: Okay, then. If you found it in her sketchbook then how did I get it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Matilda’s other assistant Grace confirmed seeing Ella give you copies of her sketches. Apparently you had them on you when you went in on your Fab Five pitch meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And from there the story writes itself. You showed your designs and they just weren’t good enough to make the cut. But then the artistic director sees these in your bag. The fresh, stunning, raw talent perfect for the Fab Five.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except they weren’t your designs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Only two people knew that. You and Ella. And being a Fab Five designer could literally make your career. So you made a choice.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Once you were chosen for the Fab Five, you realized that Ella would know that you had stolen her designs. You had to discredit her so no one would believe her.

utterance.speaker: YUMI
utterance.content: I want a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ella must have confronted Yumi at his studio. If she threatened to expose the scandal, his career would have been over. He had to kill her to hide the truth.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. That all makes sense. Now we just have to connect him to the crime scene.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Only one problem. We can’t. Yumi didn’t kill Ella.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How do you know?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Multiple employees saw Ella confront Yumi. But after she took off he was at the studio until 3AM. He never left.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Are you – are you sure?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: His alibi’s rock solid.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But we know someone changed Matilda’s calendar from that studio. He has to be involved somehow.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I think someone else was, too. I went through Yumi’s phone records, and after Ella left he made half a dozen phone calls. To Modern Fashion.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Such beautiful designs. After all this time, I had no idea. If she knew these designs had been stolen why didn’t she come to me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe she didn’t think you would listen. At least, not to someone like her. Maybe she just wanted revenge.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: She would have gotten it if Couture Chic had exposed our Fab Five list was corrupt. It would have cost me my job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who else stood to lose?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Everyone involved, I suppose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, just after Ella left Yumi’s studio, he made a series of phone calls to someone here at Modern Fashion.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone who must have known Yumi’s secret, who was helping him cover it up. Someone who knew if it got out it could destroy them both.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: There’s only one person it could be.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: We go to press in one week on this issue and I’m still not happy with the cover options. And we’re still not there on the Fab Five spread. Now go! Please! Make it better.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: What was your first reaction when you saw Yumi’s design submission?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: Blown away. That’s why I nominated him.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Now, is there a reason why you didn’t come to me and tell me when he confessed to you that he stole Ella’s design?

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: I had a word with Yumi this morning. He told me you’ve known for a while. And he also said it was your idea to change my calendar.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: He’s lying.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: And then I spoke to Mr. Carter and he confirmed my suspicion. You’ve been gunning for my job.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: What does that prove?

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: It proves that you tried to kill two birds with one stone. You changed my calendar to try to discredit Ella and undermine me.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: You don’t know what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: MATILDA
utterance.content: Don’t even. You’re fired.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: I can walk out of here and get hired at any magazine I want by the end of the day.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You won’t be applying for a new job any time soon, Julian.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: This is ridiculous. Matilda King sure takes pleasure in torturing people like this. Fact is, her story is as crazy as she is.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except we searched the dumpsters around your apartment and we found Ella’s scarf, the one that you used to strangle her. The lab also found two sets of DNA on that scarf. Ella’s and yours.

utterance.speaker: JULIAN
utterance.content: I’m not going to say another word until my lawyer’s present.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What did the DA say?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That Julian’s going to plead not guilty and take his chances at trial.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, the good news is Yumi cut a deal to avoid charges. I guess murder is not his type of accessory.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. He confessed to telling Julian that Ella figured it all out, and Julian told him that he would take care of her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So I guess the Fab Five’s going to be the Fab Four this year.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I always thought the fashion industry seemed glamorous. It turns out mobsters are more ethical.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh my gosh, why do you think I quit? I’ll take murderers over models every day.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If only murderers were this hot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve got a bit of paperwork to do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah … boring paperwork. And that is my cue to leave. I’ll see you later?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah. I’ll see you when I’m done.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey. Shall I pour you a glass?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no. Not right now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Babe, we have to talk.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. That’s something people say before they deliver bad news.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … you know when you called up last night, about the venue? I was with Matilda. She wanted me to model a dress. And it was a wedding dress. And when I saw myself in it, I just – I started to think about my mom. She would have loved to have been a part of all of this, to help pick out the flowers and try on the dresses and … when I looked at myself in the mirror I – I halfway expected to see her right behind me. And she wasn’t there. And just for a moment I thought to myself, I don’t know if I can do all of this without her. And that’s why I said no when you asked about the venue. I’m so sorry. It was stupid –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. No, not stupid. Human.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know what else I wish she could experience? You.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. She would have loved you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Kate, if you need more time –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No. No, I don’t need any more time. I don’t even want us to wait until the fall. I think we can find a new venue in the spring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You think we can pull it off?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, I already have the dress.
